com.vijfhart.casus.tree.tree

Interface Tree<E extends Node<E>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<E>, TreeIterable<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NodeTree

    public interface Tree<E extends Node<E>>
extends TreeIterable<E>
    A tree represents a collection of nodes which can be iterated. Besides that, the tree will be able to perform operations for descendants of nodes.
    Author:
    Dirk Luijk

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(E node)
      Adds a node to the tree.
      double descendantsAvg(E node, NodeDouble<E> nodeDouble)
      Returns the average of the double values of the nodes descendants.
      double descendantsAvg(E node, NodeInt<E> nodeInt)
      Returns the average of the integer values of the nodes descendants.
      int descendantsCount(E node)
      Counts the number of descendants.
      Tree<E> descendantsOf(E node)
      Returns a new tree, containing the descendants of the passed node.
      double descendantsSum(E node, NodeDouble<E> nodeDouble)
      Returns the sum of the double values of the nodes descendants.
      int descendantsSum(E node, NodeInt<E> nodeInt)
      Returns the sum of the integer values of the nodes descendants.
      void setSiblingsComparator(java.util.Comparator<E> comparator)
      Changes the way siblings are compared.
      int size()
      Returns the size of the whole tree.
